Restore the puzzle to its state before opening this \'macro\'.

Forward and reverse paths match, or puzzle completed.
This feature is not available in reverse mode!
The solution could not be completed!
No macro file found to read!
" puzzle number, select consecutively forward or backward to:"
【Single click on empty space】: Move the player (must be reachable position)
【Single click on player】: Shows reachable positions for the player

【Single click on box】: Shows its reachable positions. If this box is part of a \'staircase\' formation and is the first step in the \'staircase\', clicking on the second box in the \'staircase\' while in its reachable state will show the \'staircase\' walking method. Click again on a reachable position to automatically push the box into place
【Double click on player】: For certain skins, manual switching between landscape and portrait modes is required, i.e., rotating walls or player 90 degrees to the right
【Double click on box】: When automatic box numbering is disabled, manually assign box numbers (A-Z, A0-A9~Z0-Z9)
【Double click on wall, outside wall】: Switch between full-screen and regular mode

【Long press on wall】: During forward movement, indicates boxes that have not been moved and floors that have not been used. Exception: At the initial state of the puzzle (where moves are 0), display answer information for this puzzle; During reverse movement, if \'position double push\' is enabled, toggle whether to display \'forward and reverse push double target points
【Long press on box not on a point】: Indicates boxes that can be moved
【Long press on box or point (requires setting switch)】: During forward movement, indicates related nodes and gateways

【Long press on empty space】: Includes long press on point during reverse movement and long press on point when \'long press point hints related network\' option is turned off during forward movement, indicating which boxes can be pushed (pulled) to this location. Click the box again to automatically complete the push (pull)

【Long press on player】: During forward movement, at the initial state of the puzzle, toggle whether to \'automatically load the latest status\'. Otherwise, select the starting point for \'exporting GIF\' (no need to select when starting from the initial state of the puzzle). During reverse movement, toggle the \'position double push\' option
【Single click on top row \'puzzle number\'】: In macro debugging mode, end debugging. Otherwise, load and execute macros
【Single click on top row \'move steps\'】: Toggle \'progress bar
Single click on top row \'push steps\'】: Increase cycling speed
【Single click on top row \'cursor indicator\'】: Quickly change background or skin
【Long press on quick background color change】: Change whether to display current time on background switch option
【Long press on top row \'puzzle number\'】: Toggle \'odd and even grid mode
【Long press on top row \'move steps\'】: Toggle \'interactive double push\' mode (\'interactive double push\' mode: forward and reverse push each other\'s boxes as target points)
【Long press on top row \'push steps\'】: Toggle \'automatic box numbering
【Long press on top row \'cursor indicator\'】: Toggle \'show ruler\'
【Long press on bottom row \'back\' button】: Equivalent to \'restart\'
Long press on bottom row \'forward\' button】: During reverse movement, equivalent to \'move to end\' (during forward movement, affected by \'only push during demonstration\' option)
【Long press on bottom row \'rotate\' button】: Equivalent to \'rotate 0\'
【Long press on bottom row \'more\' button】: End the game and return to the previous puzzle.
Reminder: When pushing full-screen puzzle puzzles, \'forward\' and \'back\' buttons can be dragged to change positions.
Top Row: Materials, puzzle dimensions, number of boxes, target counts, or ruler, position, and other information
【Single click on \'Materials\' in the top row】: Select materials and automatically enter \'regular editing\' mode
【Long press on \'Materials\' in the top row】: In \'block editing\' mode, fill or stroke the selected area
【Single click on \'Puzzle Dimensions\' in the top row】: Switch between \'block editing\' mode and \'regular editing\' mode, defaulting to \'block editing\' mode
【Long press on \'Puzzle Dimensions\' in the top row】: Selects the entire area with the minimum selection when no drawing has been made, selects all when not yet drawn
【Long press on \'More\' button】: End editing and return to the previous puzzle.
【Single click on \'Puzzle Map\'】: Use two clicks to define a selection area (rectangular area), allowing cut, copy (paste), transform, fill, and other operations
【Double click on \'Boundary\'】: Automatically increases puzzle dimensions.
【Single click on \'Puzzle Map\'】: Draw on the puzzle map
【Single finger, slight delay swipe on \'Puzzle Map\'】: Continuous drawing.

Reminder: \"Blocks\" in the editing area can be saved individually. After saving, return to the \'Puzzles Creation\' browsing interface to perform similar searches on this \"block\". For similarity searches, standardization is applied to regular puzzles for comparison, but not to \"created puzzles\". When an image is recognized and sent to the puzzle editor, the cropped image serves as a reference base map for puzzle editing. Double-clicking on the top material row can toggle the display of the reference base map on or off.
【Double click on Puzzle Map】: Switch between \'Overview\' and \'Standardization\' modes for the puzzle. In \'Standardization\' mode, similar areas are highlighted with a red box.
1. Only forward pushing supports macro functions.
2. Reverse pushing supports only the import of regular actions, but
before regular actions, the starting coordinates of the player can
4. Edited macro commands cannot be stored, but
accessed in document form in the \"macros/\" folder.
5. For regular actions in forward and reverse pushing, you can
choose to execute \"from current point\". If not selected, then
it means executing the imported actions from the initial state of the puzzle.
Selecting \"Rotate according to puzzle\" is not the same concept as
rotating or flipping in the menu.
6. Before reverse pushing actions, the coordinates of the player
can be omitted. In this case, it generally means executing the
imported actions \"from current point\". Before forward pushing
actions, coordinates can be included, and in this case, the
actions will be processed according to the macro.
二、Special Notes on Coordinates in Reverse Pushing Actions:
1. When importing reverse pushing actions, two coordinates are
involved: (1) the coordinates in the imported actions, referred
to as \"imported coordinates\", and (2) the coordinates of the player
already present in the puzzle, referred to as \"puzzle coordinates\".
2. Before execution, if \"from current point\" is selected, the
\"puzzle coordinates\" will be used by default. Otherwise, it will
3. When the default coordinates do not exist or are invalid, an
attempt will be made to use the other coordinates. That is,
attempts will be made to execute the imported actions. If both
sets of coordinates cannot be used, the import will be invalidated.
4. \"Invalid imported coordinates\" refers to coordinates outside the
puzzle boundaries or positions where the player cannot be placed. \"Puzzle
coordinates\" do not have the concept of invalidity.
The operation was interrupted. The import may be incomplete!
A network error occurred while downloading the list of puzzles:
A network error occurred while downloading the list of main levels:
The competition has expired. Please stay tuned for the next one!

Network error. Please contact the website administrator or programmer!
Restart the app to apply the language change.
